meanings.def: to walk up and down in a small area many times, especially because you are feeling nervous or angry
examples: + adv./prep. She paced up and down outside the room.
I paced nervously back and forth across the room.
pace something Ted paced the floor restlessly.
He paced slowly back and forth.
Ella got up and started pacing around the room.
He was pacing the room like a caged animal.

meanings.def: to set the speed at which something happens or develops
examples: One runner was selected to pace the race.

meanings.def: to find the right speed or rhythm for your work or an activity so that you have enough energy to do what you have to do
examples: He'll have to learn to pace himself in this job.
